name: pocketgamer
header: Puzzle Quest 3 review - "Engaging combat, but not the most free-to-play friendly"
content: what is it about games that really gets our gears going is it the splashy animation sequence that congratulates you on a successful match or simply the satisfaction of linking colours together much like the toddler toys of our youth there definitely an itch there that yearning to be scratched and infinity plus two with games found that secret sauce first with the puzzle quest franchisein puzzle quest players can dive back into the trailblazing ip with a brand new quest to save the world but is the third instalment of the beloved franchise worth coming back tothe story of puzzle quest expected of any oldschool rpg you start off as a regular character that thrust into a quest to save the world of etheria of course it wouldn be an rpg without those random encounters along the way which range from pesky goblin nuisances to the occasional npc that needs help with a few chorescharacters you meet along the way may just join your cause as followers who can grant you special boons in and out of combat the very first one you meet eveline can create and exchange relics for you which are useful upgrade materials you need to buff your gear you also get to recruit minions that can help you unlock special chests or provide support during pvp combatpuzzle quest gameplay and visualsthis lovely combination of and rpg gameplay elements is what made the puzzle quest franchise popular and this time visuals are in full you pick your class paladin berserker shaman assassin or necromancer and engage in puzzle battles with monsters in the field where you can not only match colours skulls and gems vertically and horizontally but also diagonallywhat makes this new instalment even more unique is the fact that there a timer that starts once you start matching your first gem and you can match as many tiles as you want to until the timer runs out it best then to calculate your plan of attack beforehand to execute it in one blow once the timer starts adding a new layer of strategy to the gameplayyou are however manipulating your board all by your lonesome your enemy doesn have the same luxury this means that a tile you may have overlooked will still be there during your next turn each character class also has unique spells that correspond to colours on the board so you can pick the one which suits your playstyle best you can still create new characters in limited slots so don worry if you can make up your mind right awaywhile the elements may seem straightforward the rpg elements are anything but outside of combat you pick up gear from loot upgrade them salvage the ones you don need and evolve your weapons and equipment to the highest rarity for more devastating damage you can do the same for your spells as you can switch up your loadouts to equip the abilities you think will save you in a pinch in the world tab you can also take part in limitedtime boss battles participate in raid dungeons for materials and take on daily challenges for more valuable lootwhat the appealwhile all of these are typical elements of mobile rpgs nowadays the content feels a little too restrictive due to the timers on practically everything for instance opening chests require specific keys and if you don have them you can send your minions to do the work for you which will take hours before the chest can be opened you can also pay your way through gems to speed things up this instantpay feature is also present in followers tasks plus in unlocking slotsin particular you only have limited slots for storing chests and whatnot so if you want more you have to pay up upgrade materials are also a little difficult to come by if you don grind in the dungeons enough plus there a difference between paid currencies and being an actual vip there are just some things your paid currencies can buy if you not in the vip clubwith the many many many materials you need to upgrade gear it can be a challenge to progress if you looking for a more casual experience it not all about your prowess here winning matches means being able to maximize all the gear you got and you can do that if you don pay attention to each detail of each game content it can be pretty overwhelming at times the game definitely isn made to simply feed your hunger as a pickupandgo titlethe pvp element is also a little underwhelming at the moment as you matched with a random player that you can switch out it simply a matter of which player has the higher combat power most of the time which doesn really leave too much room for strategic thinkingstill puzzle quest is an enjoyable experience and it not something you can simply breeze through i myself have been playing the game for a little under two weeks now and i still feel like i barely scratched the surface it meant to be a live game after all with plenty of other robust updates to come as the developers finetune the title in the future

name: pocketgamer
header: Figure Fantasy review - "Fantasies fulfilled and more"
content: wish fulfilment at its finest figure fantasy is the answer to anyone who ever wanted to play with figurines and marvel at their collection on a customised shelf i myself am already guilty of this irl but as i sure any collector would agree with the budget and shelf space is limited while we all wish we had unlimited resources to complete our collections it just not feasible in real life especially when you adulting is itthankfully figure fantasy knows your deepest hurts and pains and wants to help you with your fantasy and no it doesn have to cost an arm and a legthe story of figure fantasyinterestingly enough figure fantasy does have an intriguing narrative that justifies why your toys are coming to life all of a sudden out of nowhere it not simply a toy storyesque affair here the characters in the game actually have a deeper motivation apart from just provoking the big fat cat we love you gingeryou play as the master of these figurines in your room and while it can feel a little odd to be talking to them don we all do that in real life sometimes and interacting with them the narrative does a good job at achieving suspension of disbelief i also really appreciate how you can skip a cut scene and still go back to them in your gallery just in case you missed something or you want to leisurely watch the story unfold when you got some spare timefigure fantasy graphicsthe visuals of figure fantasy are what differentiates this title from all other mobile gacha games out there each figure is so beautifully rendered with realistic lighting and textures that i really do feel like i playing with real figurines each time i log into the game characters are uniquely designed as well from their masterfully crafted positions to the gorgeous base plates that the higherstar ranking characters haveto be honest i often spend a good chunk of each gameplay session just rearranging stuff in my ingame shelves in the otaku zone decorating my room with fancy ornaments and finding the best spot for my favourite figurines they simply too pretty to ignore and if i could i love to put them all up for display you can only do so a limited number of times but your shelf capacity does increase as you level upas for during combat the graphics also do a marvelous job at bringing these figurines to life as each battle animation or special move executed looks absolutely gorgeous the character art itself even in mode looks stunning as it is add that to the variety of characters you can pull from the gacha pool and you really will want to collect them allfigure fantasy gameplaytypical of the genre you have your regular dungeons for material collection your pvp modes your endless tower and your rogueliteesque mode battles are your standard idle game affair where you can choose to toggle the auto button on or off you also receive idle rewards to help level up your characters as well as a way to match the level of all your characters with your top five figurinesskills you develop are reimagined in such a way that makes you feel like you really collecting toys from different brands and the gacha system reinforces that same aesthetic you have blind boxes delivered to you when you pull from the summons pool you can even sign up for a kind of collector membership vip card for premium members of courseyou can also hold up your figurines turn them around play with them and paint them all these things make what familiar and wellloved in gacha titles more interesting since the game adds a fresh twist to tired old elementswhat the appealit difficult to find something to complain about here i thoroughly enjoying figure fantasy beautiful roster of husbandos and waifus i just think it absolutely genius to paint everything you normally find in an idle gacha game in a whole new light by making everything figurinethemed even the skills that you upgrade are based on the toys descriptions and manufacturing histories for instance the elemental attributes you normally find in rpgs have been renamed as brands with affinities and synergies based on classesthe fact that you can take a photo of your lovely figurine collection in ar mode also blurs the lines between what real and what not a little bit and it really almost like you own these digital figurines in real life my photography skills need a lot of work but you get the ideaoverall figure fantasy takes your typical gacha game and puts a unique spin into it and it very very consistent even backdrops and sets are all done in miniature mode it doesn feel paytowin at all as ingame currencies are pretty generous you can definitely pull toptier characters as a player in my experience and it doesn feel grindy either if anything it a great way to quench your thirst for collecting figurines because who says digital and physical ownership have to be mutually exclusiveif you like the game as much as we did use some of ourfigure fantasy codesand get a good headstart but you should also take a look at thetier list and a detailed reroll guide

name: pocketgamer
header: Avolteha is a point-and-click passion project ten years in the making, now open for pre-order
content: picopeople has announced the upcoming launch of avolteha the indie studio pointandclick adventure that ten years in the making coming to ios on may the game takes players on a whimsical journey entirely without wordsin avolteha players step into the shoes of paul and travel the world overcoming language barriers without any text conversations are entirely in handdrawn speech bubbles with the aim of making the game accessible to anyone typical of the genre players can pick up items and figure out how to make use of them to solve various puzzles the game can also be played simultaneously with up to four players and progress can be synchronised via icloudthe visuals of the game do look interesting and i personally feel like it has a wallace and gromit vibe to it you can take a quick sneak peek at the embedded clip above to get a feel of the gamein the idea came up to develop a point and click adventure game at that time nobody would have guessed that this would take more than years says picopeople from the official press release the first concept of avolteha was a game completely without writing based on this the story puzzles and first design ideas were created over the next few years the first rooms graphics backgrounds and game characters were developed this was an extremely lengthy process because all graphics and animations were created with the help of a program complex landscape scenes sometimes took several months to create this resulted in over individual images for the character animations objects backgrounds and speech bubbles all speech bubbles were drawn by handavolteha will soon be available to download on the ios app store for with preorders now openwant more similar tiles check out these top best pointandclick adventure games on iphone and ipad ios

name: pocketgamer
header: Hitman Sniper: The Shadows review - Misses the mark by a long shot
content: it has been quite a while since the last hitman game came out on mobile so when square enix announced at they were gearing up for a sequel players were excited a few days ago the company announced that hitman sniper the shadow will roll out on march and as promised the game was available for download on google playthe download size for android devices is about additional optional downloads can be made after you install the game the ui looks ultramodern just what youd expect from a game the cutscenes introduce you to the world of stealthy assassinsgameplay remains true to the original but feels repetitivehitman sniper the shadows gameplay resembles its predecessor a lot players have to move around rather stealthily and take down enemies from a distance you are armed with a sniper rifle and you can scope in up to eight times players can get creative while carrying out the assassination contractsafter a while the gameplay feels repetitive i expected a more liberal experience maybe an openworld and more control over the weapons but the gameplay is rather limiting most of the time youll be aiming zooming and shooting with little else to dothe campaign feels like a long tutorialmaybe the campaign was meant to be a training ground for all the pvp action after a long tutorial on how to aim shoot and use special abilities you can start with the contracts but they feel like an extension of that long tutorial somehow the ai feels slow the targets and henchmen dont react fast enoughpvp is actionpackedof course the multiplayer mode of any game is loaded with action and hitman sniper the shadows is no exception the whole point is to shoot as many targets as you can and not get yourself killed thats it but if you like sniping and scoping this pvp is a real treathitman sniper the shadow tries to beat the monotonousness with more maps and they can be played in day and night mode which is quite the upgrade compared to the original titleplot steals the show characters look interestingthe plot steals most of the show and overshadows the repetitive campaign the cutscenes will hook players and lure them into unravelling the plot agent is missing and other assassins have gathered under the shadow for initiative hitman sniper the shadows you can choose from six playable characters each one is introduced with a backstory and unique attributes in future updates i would like to see some more characters to make pvp more engagingadfree with microtransactionsthe microtransaction model gives it a paytowin feel which might be a turn off for many unlike the original game hitman sniper the shadow is free to download and play however you will see how the game slowly nudges you to buy itemsof course the game is absolutely freetoplay and you wont have to spend a dime to win but with real cash you will unlock premium items faster

name: pocketgamer
header: Marvel Contest of Champions is celebrating the release of Doctor Strange: Multiverse of Madness with the addition of Wong and Rintrah
content: with just a few days to go until marvel studios extremely anticipated movie doctor strange multiverse of madness marvel fans including me are super excited and to celebrate the launch of this movie marvel games are hosting special events as well marvel content of champions latest update brings heroes and events from the movie into the gamesubscribe to pocket gamer onthe current sorcerer supreme in the mcu is wong and he will be joined by the mythical minotaur rintrah as they use their sling rings to teleport into the world of marvel contest of champions there they will join forces with america chavez and help her face a strange enemy that threatens the battlerealm the threat is magnified as another force has made its way here and can only be defeated by bargain fans mustve guessed im talking about the first movies big bad dormammu players must complete all of his challenging trials to slow him down and earn numerous mystical rewardsthis is quite the dynamic duo as wong is powerful wizard master of mystic arts and is hailed as the present sorcerer supreme a being full of knowledge and a lot of sass wong resides in the sanctum sanctorum and prevents the world from any magical threats on the other hand rintrah is a minotaur from the planet rvaal where he first discovered his magical capabilities to push his skills to the next level he is now learning more under stephen strange himselfadditionally the new set of trials is coming to torture thronebreaker and higher players it is a fiveweek long challenge that features a new fight each week with the fifth week being a culmination of all previous four fights players making it through all that pain and denial will be rewarded handsomelyready to get your magic on download marvel contest of champions for free on the app store and google play

name: pocketgamer
header: Nacon MG-X Pro Mobile Controller review - "A practically perfect mobile gaming controller"
content: it has been less than four months since we reviewed nacon mgx so it incredibly tempting to make this article about how the mgx pro compares to it however i actually spent a lot of time comparing the mgx to the xbox controller and for good reason so this is going to be a split comparison between the exceptional predecessor and its mainstream console contemporarynacon mgx pro mobile designfor a start the biggest change is the actual appearance of the device on the whole gone are the rounded switchreminiscent edges of the nonpro version and they been replaced with full consolecontroller style grips for your hands it taken a device that looks like it has the xbox license to a device that looks like somebody has stretched out an xbox controller to accommodate a phone screen in the middle of it in fact in person it looks even more like that than on the developer website where the images of it lack the menu button designs and the colour is a paler grey rather than the classic stark xbox blackit pretty close to the xbox controllerin fact i can help but wonder if the only reason that nacon has not taken their already nighperfect controller design and brought it even closer to the xbox controller design is actually licensing related a major indicator of this comes from the changes to the face buttons the face buttons on the last iteration were smaller and much closer to the current xbox design but in moving to an xbox shape and indeed xboxstyle concave analoguestick heads they actually made wider moreshallow face buttons this is a bit of a shame as the buttons on the previous version were great although i do have to say that these current ones still have that great feedback click to thembut that a tiny complaint the improved grips are a great addition to an already incredibly strong feature list for nacon premium offering and it makes the whole thing feel a lot more robust all of the perks from the previous device fast bluetooth pairing great trigger feedback clear xbox branding and suitability for large phones are all still there and it feels great to play games on itno companion app but it not a big dealfor better or for worse there no companion app for the mgx pro some would say that an advantage as other controllers sometimes make it practically mandatory to download the app but with an app comes additional configuration options in configuration options aren required for things like stadia and xbox live but for some that might be a deciding factor one thing that does seem to be taken as better everywhere that i seen it mentioned however is that unlike some other mobile controllers the extending grip doesn have rounded frames on either side allowing for folding phones or phones in cases to be mounted to the devicei said before that i was surprised that the mgx wasn being bundled with phones and xbox game pass i now know why it because that something that should be done with the mgx pro instead it almost certainly the best controller for playing games on your mobile phone

name: pocketgamer
header: One Hand Clapping review - "Figuratively and literally breathtaking"
content: set in a fantastical world where being pitchperfect is a matter of life and death one hand clapping stands out from other cookiecutter platformers out there in that this time it not all about your leaping prowess knowing exactly how to calculate the distance you need to jump through the air isn going to save you when push comes to shove it all about your vocal chops here and no you don have to be a grammy winner to nail the perfect notebad dream games vocal platformer is laudable in its attempt to do something different with a tired ol genre but is that gimmick enough to truly make this title shinetable of contentsthe story of one hand clappingfrom the getgo the game thrusts you into a dark and gloomy place where everything is pitch black you have to find the strength within you to speak up and sing your song per se as the notes you sing will light the way for you the very first stage is mainly that you walk along some dreary ruins and illuminate your path by singing or rather humming at an acceptable volumesilent city as the first chapter is called doesn really require you to bust out that singing voice you only ever unleashed in the shower you mostly get by with just a few consistent hums you hold long enough to cross certain platforms sometimes staying quiet saves you from the creepy shadows lurking in the corner other times singing drives them away they after you for some reason and you need to do everything you can to escapenow i don say for some reason lightly here as there really is no explanation whatsoever as to where you are who you are and why there are black bloblike goo thingies with eyes following your every move this is one of my biggest problems with the game to be honest as i always connect with a game via its story first and foremostthe lack of a narrative here takes away from my engagement as i don even know what my motivation is or why i even trudging along countless other games can tell a story beautifully despite the lack of any words said and it a shame that one hand clapping couldn achieve the same thingone hand clapping gameplay and visualsobviously with such a unique gameplay mechanic i suppose i can forgive the fact that the narrative fell by the wayside here the highlight is really the unique voicecontrolled movement of the character in that you will need to sing different pitches to create your own platforms break down barriers and even turn switches on and offwhen you leave silent city the game really starts to open up now you can simply rely on random humming anymore you really have to find the confidence to overcome your inhibitions and sing to match certain tones even if you may look absolutely ridiculous this game shouldn be played in publictrue to its genre there is a wide variety of puzzles you need to solve but unlike other platformers you have to sing high or sing low to progress through the levels you also sometimes have to match the beat of rhythms based on onscreen prompts as well as memorise a song sequence to get bynow while things feel intuitive at first the difficulty level does increase mainly because you often wonder what the heck you supposed to do next i do feel like there a lack of instructions here as it easy to get stuck in one place just because you didn know you could actually cross a certain wall that open up a new scenethe movement also isn linear so you may think you need to go right when you actually need to go left these seemingly little inconveniences add up and it can be frustrating especially when you got a hoarse voice and all you want is for a level to end so you can give your vocal cords a restthankfully the visuals of one hand clapping help mitigate the temptation to ragequit the artwork is just lovely to look at and the ambient soundtrack even lovelier to the ear landscapes are breathtaking and colours are masterfully executed to compliment the vibe of certain levels honestly if it weren for the visuals of the game i would have dnfed this game early onwhat the appealone hand clapping i feel is a bit of a missed opportunity i absolutely love how unique the idea is and the visuals are just topnotch i also really love how you encouraged to let go of your inhibitions to succeed herethat said i got mixed feelings with this title precisely because singing through each level is so darn tiring it doesn feel like a casual game that relax you even if the visuals say otherwise you can adjust the pitch and calibrate your mic sensitivity in the settings but that not enough to help you out of a pinch when you just can seem to hit the right noteadd that to the absence of any real story and any emotional investment in the character and it a little difficult to fall in love with the game it also doesn help that doing a running jump on the touchscreen is just an absolute pain you also likely run out of breath from trying to hold notes for too long if you can even hit the right note at allstill it a great game to try out if you looking for a fresh twist to your average platformer so it still worth a shot for a session or two a day if anything it a creative way to help you find confidence in your voice which isn something you can easily find in video games just like thatas you probably a big fan of platformers you should definitely take a look at these

name: pocketgamer
header: Honor 50 review - "Great for social media fans, and a strong show from Honor"
content: everybody has a phone now in fact quite a few of us have multiple phones over the years the market has fluctuated and shifted but we at a point where a lot of the big phone manufacturers out there are brands that we known of for years honor and their honor enters the market in the strangest of ways though it a brand we know but the manufacturer used to be a label a subcompany while it now stands independent of its former huawei parent companyso the honor is in some ways a debut device a courageous foray into the european market and at an affordable midrange price point too but on the other hand this is a company that has marketed plenty of other phones and devices over the years so there an expectation there for them to not only step forward from the issues be that diplomatic or technical that they had in the past but also to push forward technologicallykey hardware features of honor simultaneously a challenging and unique opportunity and for the most part honor has succeeded from looking at their own list of key features oled display honor supercharge ultra clear camera super curved display qualcomm snapdragon it incredibly clear who they made the phone for the design which features a dual ring design on the back the wraparound screen and a borderstyle wraparound casing element only hammers this in it a phone designed for young social media users it a massive market and the price point opens it up for that audiencewith dimensions of x it actually comes in a little larger than the iphone pro max due to its height that said there a thin black border around the screen and the curvature of the screen on the sides is quite subtle so the screen is about standard for a phone in this size range i never actually been a fan of curved screen phones because i have a permanently broken thumb which means i sometimes miss with gestures and inputsi was pleased with the honor curved screen despite the opportunity being there there were not any misclicks and while the gesturing in from the side is present the gripping fingers and thumbs don seem to conflict with the swiping required to use them in fact the only issue i had with the screen was that sometimes it decided it was locked and other times in a simple standby alwayslit mode these seemed to have different unlock procedures which i didn manage to fully figure out during my time with itwhat about the design of honor a sleek thin design and an incredibly light phone but the rear cameras stick out from the back which makes them as well as the sides feel like gluttons for scratching especially if shoved in a packed pocket or if dropped that said the whole thing feels very dense and robust nothing feels like it going to come loose and that sensation is underlined by the feel of the glass when holding it there was also a thin jellyplastic case included which isn the most stylish choice but serves as a good solution to potential camera crisesthe curved screen feels surprisingly responsive and i didn have any weird experiences when using the phone to play games the refresh rate was really good and the phone ran games like genshin impact wild rift and cookie run kingdom well i didn experience any odd slowdown or delayed loading times one thing that i did notice is that the edges of the screen seemed darker due to the nature of the screen although that didn really cause me any issue but might if it comes to taking precise photosbattery and an exceptional cameraas i said earlier the honor feels like it was designed with a specific audience in mind and that audience is an audience that wants a good battery strong internet capabilities and great camera features the phone delivers in all three regards it compatible out of the box and after i was done with the phone i left it at charge back in its box it persisted for three days before finally turning itself off and even then i turned it back on and it had enough charge to power on about not only does it have a really low background battery usage but it also charges really quick that said the one i received had an eu charger in it so i didn get to see how long it charged with the included chargerthe cameras though they the real centre point here both the front and rear cameras have a lot of different uses on the phone and each features a pullout wideview the main camera the rear camera has a sensor and features a zoom even at elements were distinguishable which is more than can be said for max zoom on other devices there are smaller cameras included too which help with exterior and closeup shots i a sucker for pulling focus onto closeup objects in photos and this phone really delivers on that interestingly though it really really compensates for lowlight much more than my iphone i not decided on whether this is a good thing on not yet but if you take selfies and group photos at night rather than scenic shots then this as default will likely be welcomethat also present on the portrait frontfacing camera bokeh and beauty features are present but even with both of these dialled down there a bit of compensation done by the camera when in a slightlylit room in the evenings blemishes freckles and moles can be lost quite easily due to this which is probably great if you sharing online but is a little bit odd while it does this it take an almost perfect detail from the stuff going on around you a book behind you might have a fully legible title but your freckles are gonevideos look decent tooboth sets of cameras work well for photos but they work great for video you can capture at decent resolutions for both although the wideangle lens will only capture up to but the most interesting thing is the multivideo mode which captures from both cameras at the same time showing your reaction to what you see in realtime i quite often take video calls with my children and we regularly flip the camera or rotate the phone to show what we are talking about this while not compatible with how we stay in touch feels like a peek into the future and is a really cool feature for videobased social mediadoes it have access to google serviceslet dip from new features to the elephant in the room the honor is pretty much fully equipped with the core apps in the google play library you can access google play store youtube gmail and more straight out of the box alongside that you find some of the honor staples that you recognise from over the years i was historically a huawei honor user and while i found some of the elements of their design to be a bit out of synch with the rest of the industry my time with the honor and psmart made me really appreciate the efforts they put into optimisation those tools are still there although you probably not going to have to lean on the optimisation tool as often as i had to back in the day in fact it probably of note that the honor comes preloaded with fewer builtin apps than most of its highrange competitorsas a final note the honor is another victim of the recent antiaudio jack movement there are usbc headphones included which is great and you can obviously grab an adapter but this still feels like a bit of an odd trend that is spreading through the industry quicklyif you looking for a phone that can capture video and photos in a variety of interesting ways can function well at night runs games and media well and has a pretty great battery then you can go wrong with the honor

name: pocketgamer
header: Touchgrind Scooter review - "Sick tricks and fab flips (once you get a hang of the controls)"
content: while there something a little unsettling about an autonomous scooter having a go at the rails around town touchgrind scooter does grow on you after a few tries part of the popular touchgrind series and definitely one of the more peculiar ones in my opinion the mobile sports game lets you or rather your humanless scooter flip through the air across vibrant cityscapes to reach that sweet sweet high scorethe goal is simple perform tricks with your scooter get a high score and nab those ultimate bragging rights so you can rub your win in your friends faces but while the mechanics of touchgrind scooter might seem easy enough the odd twofinger controls complicate things a little bitto move your ghostly scooter along you have to place two fingers on it and manoeuvre across the screen it does take some getting used to because for the first few runs i couldn for the life of me figure out where the proper finger replacement should be it also doesn help that the game isn playable on my tablet for some reason so i was forced to squish my fingers on the tiny screen of my phone all while trying to get a good look at the path in front of mespeeding through the streets already poses an inherent challenge solely because of the odd control scheme and the limited view with your fingers blocking half of the screen it a little difficult to get your bearings and see what up ahead as you speed into ramps and railsof course once i did get the hang of it after many many wipeouts it did start to feel a little intuitive i ended up holding my phone with both hands and using two thumbs to move my scooter you can perform sick stunts like tailwhips and barspins as you soar through the air across various locales hitting certain target scores unlocks more locations and gear adding loads of variety to the gamenow for this review the kind folks over at illusion labs were generous enough to send me a few codes to unlock standard epic and legendary goodies they purely cosmetics but i have to admit watching a scooterfied banana do a flip in the air while a stuffed trex hangs on for dear life on its handlebars is pretty exhilaratingthe visuals are topnotch and i particularly enjoyed the background music the cool beats and adrenalinepumping melodies add to the fastpaced action of every stage after completing challenges and clearing stages you can also rank against other players and see how you doing in your city country and across the globetouchgrind scooter is a pretty feelgood game as it extremely satisfying when you land perfectly after a stuntfilled sojourn in the air it does however have more frustrating moments than rewarding ones as there are plenty of ways you can wipe out after every ramp you do respawn a few times so it pretty forgiving but it hurts your overall score if you keep failing to stick the landingto me the game is good for a stage or two but it doesn really have anything that makes me want to keep playing or keeps me from putting it down it just feels like there too much visual flavour but not enough actual content and while hitting target scores feels great the elation dies down shortly after in the end perhaps this kind of sports title simply isn my cup of tea

name: pocketgamer
header: Redmi 10 review - "Punching above its price point in more ways than one"
content: sometimes you not looking for the biggest or best phone out there let face it most of us work on computers for most of the day and there are plenty of people out there who have consoles or pcs for gaming or gasp simply play smaller less intensive games on mobile there definitely a space in the market for something like that and that exactly where xiaomi has inserted the redmi an affordable phone with more than a few surprising featuresxiaomi has an amazing broad product library with their poco mi and redmi lines as well as the various variations within each of those some of their phones really punch above their weight but there always seems to have been a deep amount of respect for the consumer wallet that definitely the case here the redmi comes in at just over which is a really respectable price for a phone of this calibreredmi design and sizethe redmi is a thin little thing although there definitely an unexpected weight to it it just under in width which is frankly ridiculous when you consider that the power button also doubles as a fingerprint scanner it not small though coming in at x it a little bit bigger than the honor which also makes it larger than the iphone pro size only means so much though but the gorilla glass screen doesn wrap around like some of its contemporaries so there is a smaller screen size than othersit a very clean design though the whole phone is incredibly flat and has a simple formfactor with the exception of a lip on the bottom of the front and the roundedrectangle camera piece on the back i still not sure why the current camera design is focused on making the cameras look like they been glued on afterwards but it is a trend that doesn seem to be going away any time soon that said i really like how the back of the redmi looks the slightly rounded shape and the positioning and size of the camera assembly reminds me of old cameras and that nuretro design deliberate or not has grown on me a lot over my time reviewing the phoneif you fancy mobile gamingcarrying on with the exterior of the phone i had the sea blue version which did quite quickly pick up a few fingerprints i was a little confused by this because i know somebody who has a redmi and they said it was quite the opposite i guess that down to the colour phone you get the fingerprint unlock on the power button is a great feature and while i don normally use such things it great to see this extra feature slipped into the design another standout is the fact that it a dual sim phone and there a microsd slot the last few phones i have reviewed haven had memory expansion options which can really be a negative if you photograph a lot or download a lot of games onto your phoneanother feature and i can believe that i celebrating this in but i am is the audio jack the audio quality is pretty great through the jack and it great that somebody out there is still making phones which take that fitting if you not using headphones though the speakers come into play the redmi has two speakers one on the underside and another on the top left of the phone that stereo rather than mono and means that if you using your phone to watch a video in landscape view then you going to have a good time perhaps even a better time than you would have with some toprange phones which tend to have mono speakersredmi screen qualitythe screen quality isn bad at all and there no suspicious dark spots or shadows around the frame of the phone i also like the ui that was used especially the split swipes from the top similar to ios devices you can pull down on one side for notifications and the other for a settings menu it very modern and if you got a busy phone then it be more than welcomeredmi camerasnext up is the cameras the redmi has pretty decent cameras considering the price point with a rear main camera an ultrawide camera a macro camera and a depth camera there also an front camera the macro camera is nice and if you not used one before then that be novel enough i mentioned before that i like taking upclose shots and pulling focus while in those shots for extra emphasis the redmi is great at picking out textures up close however it doesn pick up detail anywhere near the quality of topend phone camerasthe main camera does leave something to be desired when it comes to general brightness and light adjustment however the ultrawide camera works really well in both lowlight and daylight settings the night mode is pretty great if you use that feature however the moment i started using zoom in night mode i started getting a lot of false darkness in the photos i also started to experience some slowdown when i had multiple apps running on the phone and that really affected playing some of the more graphically intense gamesamazing batterybut for this price point these kinds of things are to maybe be expected unlike the jack and great stereo speakers there are more positive notes too it also has an absolutely amazing battery that said it does charge very very slow but if you charge this overnight every second or third day then you going to be laughing while other phones run flatoverall the redmi is a bit of a surprise it a really affordable phone and so the expectation and delivery in some areas is that it would be a standard phone however it has quite a few modern conveniences that would normally only be found in highend phones and so it really ends up punching well above its weight

name: pocketgamer
header: Xiaomi 11T Pro review - "Pro in name, pro in nature"
content: xiaomi has become a phone manufacturing powerhouse over the past few years and has as a result become one of the most recognised brands in phones that in no small part to the fact that they seem to have deliberately tried to break through in several different pricing tiers we recently wrote about the xiaomi redmi which is an almost budget range phone which punches well above its weight and today we talking about the xiaomi pro a midtop range phone which comes in as the swan song of their phone generationwhile writing about the redmi i mentioned the mi range as one of xiaomi brands it actually turns out that it seems to have been put aside with this the pro taking the place of the normal mi brand range that frankly makes a lot of sense because the phone comfortably operates in the pricing region with a features list that definitely justifies itthe timing might not be idealbut there a large elephant in the room at the time of writing we already starting to hear rumours of the next round of devices and with it there rumoured to be some big changes in the works especially considering some of the android architecture is starting to refresh for other brands of course all we can do at the moment is write about what we have in front of us but it does always make you wonder whether you getting extreme value for money or the final push on old kit when it comes to being on this close to a step in technology it exactly the same with retail pc chipsets as one fades out you can get a major steal on a device but if it just before a massive technology leap then you feel it a lot sooner than if you had hopped onboard midgen for a little bit more moneyxiaomi pro designbut all of that said the pro does feel like a premium topoftheline mobile phone the screen is one of the largest out there with only a small camera hole and a tiny top speaker which is practically in the outer frame and much less visible than on iphones it comes in measuring which is a clear step up from xiaomi previous phones that said it a heavy one as a result of this the phone comes in at over which is a notable increase from xiaomi cheaper devicesfront camerathat tiny little camera hole that i mentioned on the front hides a pretty powerful camera a big step up from the one we used to seeing in the lowmid range phones the portrait mode home to the everpopular bokeh effect has a very good autofocus and is great at picking out outlines of things there still the android penchant of softening faces in standard selfie mode which is always a bit of a weird one for me especially when most camera suites have custom bokeh and beauty sliders the pro comes with an autobeauty style filter on it which actually does a pretty solid job if you do want the phone to tweak your appearance for the picturemain camerathe back camera arrangement is great there are three cameras there the whopping main which does video capture an ultrawide camera and a pretty natty macro lens the cameras are all pretty great i like the ultrawide and was very impressed with how it picked out the outlines and details of things the macro camera was the real standout though it easily one of the best macro cameras out there and the sheer amount of work that the ai does while it up close and personal to the subject is phenomenalthe core camera is pretty good too is definitely in the realms you expect for the price point and it performs pretty well in daylight and lowlight you can definitely read messages while at full zoom but quality does fall away quickly and it noticeable that you zooming by the time you hit zoom night view which has always been an important part of phone photography for me is something that needs to be discussed though the auto night mode is blurry at times but mostly very good i found that i ended up manually changing modes and adjusting the lighting in which case the camera did a great job of picking lines and edges when dealing with lower lightone more thing that needs to be added about the camera though is that the default modes doesn include the super macro mode that hidden in a hamburger menu this is almost criminal considering how good the super macro is there are some other fun elements to play with too long exposure mode moving crowd and neon trails are fun to mess around with but things like this tend to only see limited usevideo capture is great the footage really pops and default lightingcontrast settings are fantastic i love that xiaomi has doubled down on their split video feature which is great for making cool reaction videos i do wish that they could be separated though but maybe that something we see in a future phonesound quality and the infamous audio jackelsewhere there a lot going on there a triple microphone array and the phone features stereo audio the bottom speaker does seem to go much louder than the upper one does however both synch up on volume when you play media so this is a bit of a moot point there a dual sim tray on the bottom which keeps the sides clear the fingerprint scan power button as well as volume controls are on the right side there room for the tray to go there because this is yet another phone that opted to abandon the humble audio jack i not sure what the audio jack did to people exactly but modern design is leaving it behindit stacks a big battery which is lightning fast to chargelet talk about the battery life for a second because that incredibly important when it comes to talking about the pro the battery is substantial and would have been considered groundbreaking just a few short years back that said the phone does eat through it if you use it a lot and have the full refresh rate on but what really impressive is that it takes up to charge this is amazing and the phone can go from flat to charged in about minutes which is no mean feat in fact it should definitely be a major consideration when it comes to purchasing choicethe fact is you can eat all the way through that battery if you wish it an incredibly powerful phone and even when i tried to push it to the extreme by running a dozen apps and playing one of the busiest games on max settings it held up there was zero slow down or hesitation and the phone didn even change temperature much under the pressureit an incredibly welloptimised phone although i wish it wasn preloaded with as many apps or the secondary browser and definitely a decent showing from xiaomi there are features galore but the camera and battery charge speed are definitely the two standouts of the bunch

name: pocketgamer
header: Top 10 best cyberpunk games for iPhone and iPad (iOS)
content: after so many people were interested in the last cyberpunk list of games for android devices i felt that those who wanted to focus on iphone and ipad might be looking for something to add to their phone there seems to be tons of cyberpunk ios games announced and launching each and every weekcyberpunk is an interesting genre coming in as a subgenre of science fiction normally taking place in dystopian futures where the world seems to be full of bright lights and characters who are always a bit grungyits how people seem to think our future might be someday full of color and capitalism that needs to be abolished by some punk who lives in the streets flying cars humans with heavy body modifications and large populations of people moving around in cramped cities are some of the common threads that you spot in these types of gamesthere is a humongous amount of breaking laws and generally ignoring the corporationcontrolled governments in these types of games if youre interested in that sort of thingif you want to submerge yourself in this sort of future all from the comfort of your house then this is the list for you this list is specifically for mobile phones and tablets on the ios operating system until those get imputed into ourselves through some sort of medical treatment

name: pocketgamer
header: EndCycle VS review - "A true labour of love - just needs a little more polish"
content: with its roguelike elements and unique gameplay mechanics endcycle vs offers something fresh for mobile gamers in that it not something you can auto your way through the pixelart roguelike pvp game lets you silence the noise across a gridbased battlefield using lots and lots of combo attacks to eliminate your foes but is that concept enough for you to give this game a goendcycle vs story and graphicswhile the game narrative is supposedly all about saving the world from ancient gods i honestly didn get the story when i started playing it would been nice if there were a primer of some sort to ease players into the lore as a narrativedriven gamer i always valued the story of a game first before the actual gameplayof course as you thrust right into battle during the tutorial there isn much time to figure out what going on only that you supposed to fight the noise which gives me chaos walking vibes to protect the people there the crimson force and azure shield and both have their own opposing motivations i did appreciate how you can play through different sides in the campaign walking you through where each side stands in this socalled wardespite not immediately knowing what was happening i found the visuals of the game very very cool and the background music even cooler while there are lots of different characters you can unlock as you progress through the game you initially start off as rozu but each character and foe boasts fluid animations and lovely character designs both in pixel form and in art form i love how unique each character looks too it really breaks away from the toomany animethemed gacha characters in the market these daysendcycle vs gameplaybecause this is mainly a vs game the main highlight is the combat you swipe your character through a grid to either dodge attacks or go on the offensive yourself using sets of moves or vocs that are represented by pixelated icons i personally have an issue with this kind of moveset as it a little confusing to get the hang of all these little icons you never really too sure what you doing until you give the icons a go and try your hardest to memorise what they forsome qualityoflife improvements will likely benefit the title here especially since the battles are so fastpaced that one wrong move might just spell your doom the colours of the tiles you on also contribute to your chances of victory and while it a nice added layer of strategy it also adds to the hectic nature of each fight add that to the crush gauge cooldown timers and the fact that you have to start over upon defeat and the pressure is really on as you enter every new fightthankfully there are plenty of modes for you to give your vocs a test run just to get used to their effects on the battlefield you can play through the story campaign which you can only fully unlock by buying the full version of the game or fight a continuous onslaught of enemies to see how long you can last you can also duke it out with others online just be sure you actually know what you doing once you out there since the lack of info on the vocs can make things very spammy in the heat of battlewhat the appealendcycle vs feels like it could be a really great game but there are some areas that still feel a little unpolished to be honest i encountered a bunch of glitches for example in the menus every so often and some of the lines of dialogue during cut scenes are barely visible in some instances there a great deal of potential in the game but these issues should probably be addressed first before it officially launched especially since it designed to be a premium game i feel because the ads are incredibly intrusivei did have a lot of fun playing the game don get me wrong the highly tactical aspect of customising your deck is an absolute joy and while i no modder it nice to see that there an option for that for the more modinclined players out there it also seems like the devs are actively listening to their eager community of fans which is always a huge plus i really did feel the nine years of hard work and patience in this mobile labour of lovein the end i think endcycle vs will benefit from a few more qol improvements to make sure its deep gameplay mechanics aren overshadowed by tiny frustrations from players who might end up dropping the game early on because of inconveniences and while i wasn the biggest fan of the way vocs were executed i did still have a blast during combat because of the totally awesome music could there be a spotify playlist for the ost maybe

name: pocketgamer
header: Hundred Days review - "A success for the management genre"
content: there are some things in life that really feel like they won convert over to games particularly well if you told me about a winemaking game a few years back then i probably have confidently slid that toward that space surprisingly then hundred days is probably one of the most poignant and engaging games i played all yearhundred days storythe biggest concern with playing a game about a process as slow and scientific as winemaking is the onboarding process hundred days alleviates that with its story mode which later blends seamlessly into a sandboxstyle of play the story starts with the protagonist a young citydweller finding out that they just inherited a vineyard that you even though you been set up with the daunting task of running a vineyard with zero knowledge of how it works you provided with a few experts who act as a very natural conversational tutorialin fact the story that comes as part of the tutorial and bleeds through into the main game is absolutely standout so much so that once the main story resolved itself a handful of hours in the absence was notable however even once it faded away the careful pace that it instils in you persistswinemaking sounds simple rightyou see winemaking is a series of consecutive procedures each performed at exactly the right time in sequence do you barrel age the wine once crushed or do you just send it to be bottled how hard do you crush the grapes do you use different yeasts or add sugar did you pick the right grapes for the right soilthere a lot of choices and sliders and tasks to be done but there also a whole string of upgrades new facilities tools and techniques to unlock hundred days greatest strength is how it introduces what could be an incredibly stressful process to you and then lets you define the pace you unlock more optionssubscribe to pocket gamer on hundred days gameplaytake away all of those sliders and buttons that i mentioned before and bring the game down to its simple form though and it becomes a simple case of dropping shapes which represent the tasks into a grid each task is a different size and certain tasks take more than one turn to clear as you add more fields yields and processes to your set up then you find yourself squeezed for space but you can upgrade your workspace to include more roomthat certainly doesn sound interesting but that because there a deeper level of play hidden between the buttons and sliders much like deeper strategy or grand strategy games there are more than a few ways to measure success hundred days isn simply about making wine you running the whole business that means that most things cost money and so you need to be making wine good enough to sell and get the money from it into the bankthere more than enough ways to spend money in the game in fact it really easy to bankrupt yourself if you rush ahead but ways to make money are decidedly more limited you want to make good wine and there are perfect elements to each of those wines as you learn more ways to ferment or treat the wine you learn how to manage things like body and sweetness it only through mastering these that you can learn how to make the wine that sells for the most because otherwise you risk having your storage filled with wine that nobody wants to buystriving to make the best wine is the real gripit the drive to learn the best techniques for each type of grape that kept me playing hundred days after a point it didn even matter to me that it was a game about wine i simply had to figure out how to tweak the final statistics to have my journal reveal the perfect wine it was the year the setting no longer mattered i simply had to keep refining the formula until i got it rightthere plenty to unlock and considering the pace of play for you to do it safely will probably take over a dozen hours it perhaps a bit sad that a lot of the upgrades end up pushing you towards mass production and automation two things the villains are depicted as doing although i do have to admit that i forgot to sell wine on more than a few turns and so things like the shop are welcome there is admittedly almost no chance that anybody would be able to handle the whole nine tracts of land without workers but i also don know if there much beyond the drive to perfect all six of the grape varieties that would keep me pushing through that much processhundred days is a fantastic example of how clever design and smart tutorials can make even the most obtuseseeming subject into a fantastic game

name: pocketgamer
header: Top 20 best Switch co-op games to play with friends and family
content: playing games on the go is what makes the nintendo switch gaming experience unique but being able to connect and play with friends makes it that much more fun platformers adventures action shooters you name it whatever is your cup of tea you can find it on the nintendo switch game librarywe put together a list of the best switch coop games so you can team up with your friends locally or online and have some fun time gaming together we tried to include various types of games for all ages so hopefully you can find the best switch games for coop let get right into it

name: pocketgamer
header: PUBG New State review - "Not-so-new state, but still enjoyable nonetheless"
content: pubg new state from krafton has been out for a few weeks now and while i a little bit late to the party it still a party nonetheless the popular battle royale game did get my adrenaline pumping with each new match but is it worth developing an obsession forpubg new state visualssupposedly a new and improved version of pubg mobile pubg new state takes players into a futuristic world devastated by battles but also still pretty coollooking the map of troi itself is sleek and technologically advanced despite the battledamaged look in particular i appreciated the tram that travels across the map on its own offering players a bit of a safe haven when they need to take a breather or a quick rideyou can always modify the graphics in your settings menu to suit your device best so to be honest the improved resolution will really depend on what you playing on i do recommend playing on a tablet at the very least as the ui is littered with a whole bunch of icons that will frankly ruin your whole gameplay experience if you keep accidentally tapping on the wrong thingyou can move around with your left thumb with a handy run function and change the camera angles with your right there are also dedicated buttons for crouching shooting changing gears and so on but all of these feel cramped on a smaller screen and can be really frustrating when you in a hurry because someone somewhere is shooting at youpubg new state gameplaystill when you eventually get the hang of the controls you find that the whole experience can be pretty enjoyable there never seems to be an end to how many ways you can kill a person here making for incredibly varied matches each timefor instance more than just gunning down someone in cold blood you can use the new drone shop to your advantage it lets you shop around for some valuable resources even while you in the middle of a match using drone credits to score goodies that can turn the tide of battle in your favour of course if you want to think out of the box you can use this tactic to lure someone to a specific locationin particular the drone shop will deploy an actual drone to your location to deliver the goods you can either make use of the supplies or purposely attract enemies to that drop zone then snipe them when they come looking for youyou can also recruit a downed enemy by reviving them and having them join your team when you still got room in your roster although i do think this is a little counterproductive as it might slow down your team tactics to have a newbie you need to reorient in the middle of a gamewhat the appealas with the rest of the genre winning is more a matter of skill rather than what your wallet can give you paying for cool stuff doesn automatically make you better at the game you can have nothing but basic gear and you can still win that sweet sweet chicken dinner at the end of the daycase in point in one match i personally witnessed my teammates sweeping through those players with ease while i died in the far corner of an abandoned building somewhere they didn even need to recruit anyone else because they were just that good and i was just that much of a noobstill it does feel a little bit like a simple reskin and the content right now isn too deep i also encountered a few bugs along the way but that likely because the game hasn been out for too long the most annoying bug i experienced was losing my account completely when i booted it uppubg new state offers a fun battle royale experience for anyone who looking for a socalled new game on mobile it great to hop into a match or two every so often but it not something i purposely lose sleep over any time soon as there are sadly better ways to spend my screen time on mobile out there but if you hungry for a fresh take on the franchise at the very least the game should be enough to scratch that itch

content: updated on april added new titles to the listoriginal article by jupiter hadley latest update by pocket gamer staffthe nintendo switch and local multiplayer games go together like chips and gravy strawberries and chocolate coffee and anxiety you get the pointdespite the new nintendo switch lite making things personal local multiplayer is where the platform shines brightest just you some family or friends couch coop and a video game you all enjoyspeaking of which local multiplayer switch games are plentiful on the nintendo eshop but these fifteen are absolute necessities to anyone who fancies playing a coop with a paljust be sure to hide any items that can be thrown in fits of rage or frustration just in case without further ado let take a look at thebest local multiplayer switch games

name: pocketgamer
header: Mini Motorways review - "Warning: objects may appear less chill than they seem"
content: filled with soft edges pastelcoloured aesthetics and an ultrachill background score mini motorways is the kind of game you likely feel drawn to from the visuals alone the sleek lines and elegant presentation invite you to come hither and take a quick look but as soon as you indulge you immediately wonder what the heck you just got yourself into the idle game challenges you in notsoidle ways and while it supposedly a simple timewaster its mechanics beg to differdon let the minimalist look fool you mini motorways is anything but simple even if your ultimate goal is only really to go from point a to point b you step into this big overarching role of managing a bustling metropolis making sure each car gets to where they need to go and backwith a bird eye view of the motorways in front of you with the clean lines and lots of white space it may seem easy to guide your little city along day in and day out but as the simple graphics and lowkey sound effects lull you to a false sense of security you soon find yourself struggling to get those colourcoded cars in orderand when your whole metro system eventually breaks down as it inevitably will it does leave you with a sense of guilt if only i squeezed in a wellplaced roundabout here and a more efficient bridge here then blue car would made it to his daughter piano recital in time and yellow car wouldn have been late for his last day at work am i investing too much into the lives of my citizensregardless of the city you pick you start off with one car and one destination you need to connect to as time goes by more cars and more targets pop up with pins on top of the locations that indicate how many cars should reach that destination in time having too many pins and not enough cars ends the game for you so you have to make each road bridge and traffic light countthe game provides you with these items over time and houses generate willynilly as the days go by as well there definitely some level of randomness involved here so it might bode well for you to build roads in places where you don want any houses to spawnof course road tiles are limited so you can just spam motorways every which way this is where you ought to unleash your inner city planner to make sure each tile you lay down is efficient and won cause any further congestion as your city gets busier and busier this progression while it does make sense honestly makes the game feel contradictory for mei not entirely sure if the game is meant to be relaxing or if that was just my expectation going into this but if mini motorways is supposed to be a lowpressure game i felt it was the complete oppositeorganization isn exactly my strong suit nor am i particularly handy when it comes to keeping things tidy which is why when pressed with a gargantuan task like this my only course of action is to panic perhaps it simply means i don do well under pressure but timed mechanics like this just don jive with meto keep frustration levels in check the game does inject a bit of variety into the gameplay with the new challenge city update here you can take on new daily and weekly challenges with varying modifiers that make each run more interesting for instance you might be given an unlimited set of road tiles or you may be given just the one motorway and nothing else these definitely spice things up if you looking for something different i also really appreciated the game accessibility options with its colourblind mode which is a nice touchstill while mini motorways is pretty entertaining i can say i be tempted to keep coming back to it likely because these highpressure challenges just aren my cup of tea visuals are lovely to look at though so if you ever feel like ragequitting you can at least have a look at the easyontheeyes graphics to tame your temper

name: pocketgamer
header: A Musical Story review - "Stunning visuals and music, if you can get past the challenging beats"
content: while working at a canning factory day in and day out can be mindnumbing a crosscountry road trip with your musical buddies should help you get away from the pressure of everyday life this is likely what pushed gabriel the main protagonist of a musical story to get up get out and chase his dreams but with gleecheese studio rhythm game things aren as simple as thatthe narrative of a musical storyin this psychedelic rhythm game players can experience a masterfully crafted story told entirely without any text or dialogue scenes from each chapter have a handdrawn painterly effect with subtle yet stunning animations that prove that a picture really is worth a thousand wordsyou start the game immediately with a scene of gabriel in a hospital under some sort of coma and you have to play through each chapter to find out just how he ended up in that hospital bed from there it a vibrant and often wild journey through music festivals jamming inside a van or around a campfire gas stops and lots of substance use this of course is what makes up the main conflict of the storya musical story gameplay and visualsto discover each new scene and to progress through the narrative you have to tap to the beat of the music playing in the background and the next part of the story will reveal itself to you challenges include everything from synth beats to drum solos and they do get harder and harder as you go alongyou be prompted to tap on the left side of your screen on the right side or together at the same time you may also have to hold a few notes until you hit a certain sweet spot the trick here is that you have to pay attention to the music more than what you see in particular there are no indicators when you have to hit the beat only that you have to feel the rhythm inside your bonesof course not everyone is in sync with their inner musicians thankfully a musical story does have an assist function you can toggle on and off if you set it to auto it will sense when you had one too many failures and a little white dot will start to appear to help you time your taps leaving it on will have that dot with you at all times for support each time you successfully complete a beat you be rewarded with a scene that plays out in front of youwhat the appealwith rhythm games the main appeal is always the music and in a musical story the masterful melodies really do pop much like the theme of the visuals the music is all about the and there were times when i almost wanted to leave the chapter as it is just to listen to the tunes in the backgroundthe art style comes alive even more with the bursts of colour in each chapter with different shades i noticed to depict certain emotions in a scene there a clever use of tones in the game that matches the music and the narrative at the same time making for an effective storytelling tool despite the lack of wordsaesthetics aside i did find the game to be more frustrating than enjoyable especially during a particularly long and frustrating section in the middle of the game the problem here is that if the music in the background just isn to your liking it hard to get into the beat which is made even worse when the music loops over and over again until you get it right the game isn meant to be finished in a single sitting but there were definitely some chapters when i felt like i wanted to stop midway and go do something elsethere were of course beautiful moments in the game and breezing through scenes with no mistakes does feel rewarding for me however there were more downs than ups in this game so it probably something that you should only play when you in a more musically inclined moodin the end the visuals and music are both topnotch but it a shame that you have to slog through some frustrating levels just to enjoy them still it a unique kind of rhythm game based on the aesthetics alone so it still worth picking up
